required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation Between Facial Measurements and Tooth Size and Pulp Volume
clinical_study.official_title: Detection of Correlation Between Facial Measurements and Tooth Size and Pulp Volume Using Cone Beam Computed Tomography

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to investigate the correlation between the measurements of the specific points of the face (lower face height, midface height, the distance between zygomatic, pupillary distance,interalar distance, epicanthus distance, the distance between commissar) and the dimensions of the maxillary sixth molar tooth (mesiodistal distance, buccal palatal distance, root length, pulp volume).

detailed_description.textblock: Radiographic images of patients who have been indicated for cone-beam computed tomography for the upper jaw for various reasons (such as impacted teeth, sinusitis, skeletal anomalies) will be reviewed retrospectively. Facial measurements (lower face height, midface height, inter-zygomatic distance, inter-pupillary distance, interalar distance, epicanthus distance, the distance between commissures) of the patients who received cone beam computed tomography will be measured in the clinic. Mesiodistal distance, buccal palatal distance, root length, pulp volume of maxillary sixth tooth will be measured using cone beam computed tomography. The data obtained will be compared.

primary_outcome.description: Distance from the most lateral parts of the arch of the zygomas
Distance the center of the pupil of the right side to the center of the pupil of the left side
Distance from ala of one side to other
Distance from commissar of the lips
distance from enamel cement border of the tooth to the mesial root apex
distance from enamel cement border of the tooth to the distal root apex
distance from enamel cement border of the tooth to the palatal root apex
Defined as the distance between two parallel planes, tangential to the most mesial and most distal points of the crown side
Defined as the maximum distance between two parallel planes, one tangential to the most palatal point of the crown side, and the other tangential to a point on the buccal crown side
The linear distance between right and left first molar teeth between the most convex palatal crown faces

intervention.intervention_name: Facial Measurements and Tooth Size and Pulp Volume
intervention.description: Radiographic images of patients who have been indicated for cone-beam computed tomography for the upper jaw for various reasons (such as impacted teeth, sinusitis, skeletal anomalies) will be reviewed retrospectively. Facial measurements (lower face height, midface height, inter-zygomatic distance, inter-pupillary distance, inter alar distance, epicanthus distance, the distance between commissures) of the patients who received cone beam computed tomography will be measured in the clinic. Mesiodistal distance, buccal palatal distance, root length, pulp volume of maxillary sixth tooth will be measured using cone beam computed tomography. The data obtained will be compared.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Upper dental arches which have maxillary first molars
- At least one tooth which has no deep caries, filling or crown restoration must be
- No resorption or pathology in the root of the tooth which disrupt integrity must be
- Healthy subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- Deep caries, filling or crown restoration
- Resorption or pathology in the root of the tooth

overall_official.affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Faculty of Dentistry

facility.name: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Faculty of Dentistry

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital
